intro: Tecoma microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved trumpetbush, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its rapid growth and ability to produce abundant flowers make it a valuable addition to landscapes.
